page.title: 01THE KNOCK-DUFTON AREA
page.content: A large part of this area is upland falling away towards the Eden Valley in the South-west where there are the two small villages of Knock & Dufton.The buildings are notable,being built predominantly of the attractive local red sandstone. The area of hill,known locally as fell,is drained by several small streams or becks.The farms on the lower slopes have allotments of rough grazing which continue up onto the higher unenclosed fell. It is a scenic area,quiet and remote from any large centre of population.The bare grassy slopes of Dufton Pike,a conical shaped hill on the edge of the fells is the prominent feature.The area is a haven for wild- life and geologically interesting. There is an area of mining development where old mines are reworked.
